page.title: 02MODERN CHESSINGTON
page.content: {The 12 km squares covered by}FLEETWOOD {school and}ELLINGHAM{school reaches {from the suburban housing cluster of HOOK{in the north to the country zoo {of}CHESSINGTON{in the south, and from CLAYGATE VILLAGE{(west) to}HORTON COUNTRY PARK{(eastern extent). Now a London overspill commuter belt inhabited by thousands, Chessing_ ton still has its old_fashioned rural institutions (like the{BARWELL ESTATE) which help preserve a country flavour. {An 1864 map shows a sprinkling of {small farms (presumably tenants of Merton College, Oxford,{which owned {the land). One or two large houses {complete the picture. { }By 1914, the Epsom hospital complex had arrived; by 1939, the{ZOO,}the{ {RAILWAY}& the{HOUSING ESTATES}had altered Chessington drastically. {
